headline: Why AT&T Stock Jumped Today
summary: AT&T stock got a lift from Verizon's recently published second-quarter report.  Verizon published Q2 sales and earnings that beat the market's expectations.  AT&T reports earnings tomorrow, and investors think that Verizon's recent performance is a positive indicator.

headline: Verizon boosts annual forecast, shares rise
summary: STORY: Shares of Verizon jumped more than four and a half percent Monday morning, after the wireless carrier raised the lower end of its annual profit forecast.That was thanks to strong demand for its premium plans and the Trump administration’s new tax law.The telecom giant said it's benefiting from favorable tax reform that allows companies to immediately write off the full cost of certain new equipment, boosting free cash flow.Verizon also beat Wall Street estimates for second-quarter sales and profit.Verizon has launched promotions and broadband-wireless bundles to retain users as competition intensifies from AT&T and T-Mobile, as well as broadband providers Comcast and Charter.But Verizon posted a surprise drop of 9,000 monthly bill-paying wireless subscribers in the second quarter, reeling from user churn after price hikes in January.Analysts polled by FactSet were expecting an increase of 13,000 subscribers.To drive growth, Verizon and its rivals have been bulking up on fiber-optic assets that can tap growing consumer data use.The company in May won approval from the FCC to acquire fiber-optic internet provider Frontier after Verizon agreed to end its diversity, equity and inclusion programs.The focus on internet services helped it post 293,000 broadband net additions in the second quarter.Verizon's earnings also helped lift shares of rivals AT&T and T-Mobile in Monday morning trading.

raw.headline: Verizon boosts annual forecast, shares rise
raw.summary: STORY: Shares of Verizon jumped more than four and a half percent Monday morning, after the wireless carrier raised the lower end of its annual profit forecast.That was thanks to strong demand for its premium plans and the Trump administration’s new tax law.The telecom giant said it's benefiting from favorable tax reform that allows companies to immediately write off the full cost of certain new equipment, boosting free cash flow.Verizon also beat Wall Street estimates for second-quarter sales and profit.Verizon has launched promotions and broadband-wireless bundles to retain users as competition intensifies from AT&T and T-Mobile, as well as broadband providers Comcast and Charter.But Verizon posted a surprise drop of 9,000 monthly bill-paying wireless subscribers in the second quarter, reeling from user churn after price hikes in January.Analysts polled by FactSet were expecting an increase of 13,000 subscribers.To drive growth, Verizon and its rivals have been bulking up on fiber-optic assets that can tap growing consumer data use.The company in May won approval from the FCC to acquire fiber-optic internet provider Frontier after Verizon agreed to end its diversity, equity and inclusion programs.The focus on internet services helped it post 293,000 broadband net additions in the second quarter.Verizon's earnings also helped lift shares of rivals AT&T and T-Mobile in Monday morning trading.

summary: Two in three Americans have said that they are concerned about the prospects of their retirement savings, with the majority worrying more about running out of money than death, according to a 2024 Annual Retirement Study by Allianz Life. headline: Verizon Earnings Push the Stock Higher. Why the Market Loves the Results.
summary: Verizon Communications  beat Wall Street’s earnings expectations and hiked its 2025 earnings and free cash flow guidance on Monday, sending the stock higher.  The wireless carrier reported adjusted quarterly earnings of $1.22 per share, as revenue climbed 5.2% from a year ago to $34.5 billion.  Verizon said that a strong performance over the first half of the year, coupled with favorable tax reforms, meant it was raising its 2025 earnings guidance.

Verizon said that a strong performance over the first half of the year, coupled with favorable tax reforms, meant it was raising its 2025 earnings guidance.

headline: Verizon boosts annual forecast on demand for premium plans, tax law benefit
summary: Shares of the company rose 3.5% on Monday as it also surpassed Wall Street estimates for June-quarter sales and profit, thanks to a 2.2% rise in wireless service revenue.  The telecom major has launched price-lock promotions and broadband-wireless bundles to retain users as competition intensifies from AT&T and T-Mobile, as well as broadband providers Comcast and Charter.  Verizon is also benefiting from favorable U.S. tax reform that allows companies to immediately write off the full cost of certain new equipment, finance chief Tony Skiadas said.

raw.headline: Verizon boosts annual forecast on demand for premium plans, tax law benefit

The telecom major has launched price-lock promotions and broadband-wireless bundles to retain users as competition intensifies from AT&T and T-Mobile, as well as broadband providers Comcast and Charter.  Verizon is also benefiting from favorable U.S. tax reform that allows companies to immediately write off the full cost of certain new equipment, finance chief Tony Skiadas said.
